description.narrative: Asociacion Minga Peru will provide communications training to 60 individuals from current and former IAF grantees in the Domnican Republic and Peru and from the organizations they serve. From that group, Minga Peru will develop a cadre of communications specialists who will go on to use their newly acquired skills to support broader civil society development in their communities and countries. Participants will document lessons and results to share with donors and other interested parties. Benefits from this project should reach between 10,000 and 15,000 individuals connected with the organizations, their communities and their partners. Through this cooperative agreement, Minga Peru will also build bridges to international networks and create a new model for providing technical assistance that may be applied in other countries throughout the region.

Asociacin Minga Per, in Peru, drawing on lessons learned from almost twenty years of working with local organizations in the Peruvian Amazon, Minga Per will provide communications training to 60 individuals from current and former IAF grantees in the Dominican Republic and Peru and from the organizations they serve. From that group, Minga Per will develop a cadre of communications specialists who will go on to use their newly acquired skills to support broader civil society development in their communities and countries. Participants will document lessons and results to share with donors and other interested parties. Benefits from this project should reach between 10,000 and 15,000 individuals connected with the organizations, their communities and their partners. Through this cooperative agreement, Minga Per will also build bridges to international networks and create a new model for providing technical assistance that may be applied in other countries throughout the region.

Asociacin Minga Per will provide training in communications, planning and evaluation for about 63 individuals drawn from current and former IAF grantees in Dominican Republic and Peru and their partner organizations. Participants will receive subgrants to implement their communications strategies and document lessons and results to share with donors and other interested parties. The benefits should flow to between 10,000 and 15,000 individuals connected with the organizations, their communities and their partners.

Asociacin Minga Per, in Peru drawing on lessons learned from almost twenty years of working with local organizations in the Peruvian Amazon, Minga Per will provide communications training to 60 individuals from current and former IAF grantees in the Dominican Republic and Peru and from the organizations they serve. From that group, Minga Per will develop a cadre of communications specialists who will go on to use their newly acquired skills to support broader civil society development in their communities and countries. Participants will document lessons and results to share with donors and other interested parties. Benefits from this project should reach between 10,000 and 15,000 individuals connected with the organizations, their communities and their partners. Through this cooperative agreement, Minga Per will also build bridges to international networks and create a new model for providing technical assistance that may be applied in other countries throughout the region.

Drawing on lessons learned from working with local organizations in the Peruvian Amazon, Minga Per will provide communications training to 60 individuals from current and former IAF grantees in the Dominican Republic and Peru and from the organizations they serve. From that group, Minga Per will develop a cadre of communications specialists who will go on to use their newly acquired skills to support broader civil society development in their communities and countries. Participants will document lessons and results to share with donors and other interested parties. Benefits from this project should reach between 10,000 and 15,000 individuals connected with the organizations, their communities and their partners. Through this cooperative agreement, Minga Per will also build bridges to international networks and create a new model for providing technical assistance that may be applied in other countries throughout the region.

Universidad de la Cordillera/Observatori o del Racismo en Bolivia (UNICOR), $85,675 over one year. Observatories are watchdog agencies that monitor social issues and recommend steps toward reform. UNICOR will support the consolidation and expansion of the Red de Observatorios del Racismo en las Americas [Network of Observatories Against Racism in Latin America] and will develop in its members the skills necessary to document racism and work to eliminate it in Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Guatemala and Mexico.

Asociacin de Capacitacin e Investigacin para la Salud Mental (ACISAM). Under this Cooperative Agreement, IAF partner ACISAM will work in four countries to further develop a network of nine grassroots associations focusing on services for people with psychiatric disabilities and for their caregivers. The partner and the associations will collaborate on organizing educational events; facilitating communications; improving their administration, leadership and partnerships; and managing a subgrant fund financing economic initiatives, training and outreach. In this cooperative agreement, ACISAM will work with the IAF on regional events, subgrant review and dissemination of lessons. Some 800 Salvadorans, Nicaraguans, Panamanians and Costa Ricans will benefit

participating-org.narrative: Asociacin de Capacitacin e Investigacin para la Salud Mental

receiver-org.narrative: Asociacin de Capacitacin e Investigacin para la Salud Mental

description.narrative: Under this Cooperative Agreement, IAF partner Asociacin de Capacitacin e Investigacin para la Salud Mental (ACISAM) will work in four countries to further develop a network of nine grassroots associations focusing on services for people with psychiatric disabilities and for their caregivers. The partner and the associations will collaborate on organizing educational events; facilitating communications; improving their administration, leadership and partnerships; and managing a subgrant fund financing economic initiatives, training and outreach. In this cooperative agreement, ACISAM will work with the IAF on regional events, subgrant review and dissemination of lessons. Some 800 Salvadorans, Nicaraguans, Panamanians and Costa Ricans will benefit directly and another 7,000 indirectly.

participating-org.narrative: Asociacin de Capacitacin e Investigacin para la Salud Mental

description.narrative: Fundacin AVINA (AVINA) in Argentina, Bolivia and Paraguay. AVINA will work with Red de Organizaciones del Chaco Americano (Redes Chaco) to further community development in the Gran Chaco Americano, which incorporates parts of Argentina, Bolivia and Paraguay. The collaborative effort undertaken by grassroots groups and donors should benefit 2,000 residents and another 32,000 indirectly.

Fundacin Social de Holcim Colombia (Holcim/CO) in Colombia is the social investment arm of a Colombian cement manufacturer and is a member of The Inter- American Network of Corporate Foundations and Actions for Grassroots Development (RedEAmrica), an IAF- initiated business- sector launched in 2002. In collaboration with other Holcim/CO foundations that are incorporated in Argentina, Brazil and Ecuador, it will develop a subgrant fund to finance grassroots projects and otherwise increase the corporation's social investment. Holcim/CO's counterpart more than doubles the IAF's funding. The grant should benefit 380 individuals directly and 1,400 indirectly.

JASS Mesoamerica (JASS Meso) will reach 400 women representing 52 Mexican and Central American grassroots organizations of activists with its program to advance the rights of women and to improve participants' collaboration on related public policy. An additional 500 women in grassroots and nongovernmental organizations across Mexico and Central America should benefit indirectly as well as networks of IAF-funded womens organizations throughout the hemisphere.

JASS Mesoamerica (JASS Meso). Meso will reach 400 women representing 52 Mexican and Central American grassroots organizations of activists with its program to advance the rights of women and to improve participants collaboration on related public policy. An additional 500 women in grassroots and nongovernmental organizations across Mexico and Central America should benefit indirectly as well as networks of IAF-funded womens organizations throughout the hemisphere.

title.narrative: International Training Centre, International Labour Organization

description.narrative: DELNET, $151,920 over two years The International Labour Organization's Delnet Program will adapt its training materials based on the feedback from surveys, fund 185 new, partial scholarships, and offer three new short courses in strategic planning and project design, sustainable tourism and local development with a focus on disaster mitigation. Approximately 185 additional beneficiaries will benefit directly.

title.narrative: Strengthening the Capacity of the Network of Observatories on Racism in the Americas

description.narrative: Corporacin Hileros/Proceso de Comunidades Negras (PCN) will support the consolidation and expansion of the Red de Observatorios del Racismo en las Americas [Network of Observatories Against Racism in Latin America], develop in its members' the skills necessary to document racism and work to eliminate it, and facilitate an information exchange and other contact. Observatories are watchdog agencies that monitor social issues and recommend steps toward reform.

title.narrative: Strengthening the Capacity of the Network of Observatorie s on Racism in the Americas

UNICOR will support the consolidation and expansion of the Red de Observatorios del Racismo en las Americas [Network of Observatories Against Racism in Latin America] and will develop in its members the skills necessary to document racism and work to eliminate it in Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Guatemala and Mexico.

Fundacin Social de Holcim Colombia (Holcim/CO) is the social investment arm of a Colombian cement manufacturer and is a member of The Inter-American Network of Corporate Foundations and Actions for Grassroots Development (RedEAmrica), an IAF-initiated business-sector launched in 2002. In collaboration with other Holcim/CO foundations that are incorporated in Argentina, Brazil and Ecuador, it will develop a subgrant fund to finance grassroots projects and otherwise increase the corporation's social investment. Holcim/CO's counterpart more than doubles the IAF's funding. The grant should benefit 380 individuals directly and 1,400 indirectly.

title.narrative: Capitalizing on practical experiences of inclusive social protection in Latin America

description.narrative: Centro de Estudios para el Desarrollo Regional (CEDER) will facilitate two training sessions to further the exchange of experiences among 11 IAF grantees whose projects focus on social protection, defined as the provision of services that reduce the adverse impact of poverty, illness, unemployment, disability and age, among other common risk factors that disproportionately affect vulnerable populations. It will also organize a regional meeting where the grantees and others can share their experiences and extract lessons, and will draft a report summarizing the most effective practices in Latin America. The project will reach 65 individuals directly and another 1,200 indirectly.

participating-org.narrative: Centro de Estudios para el Desarrollo Regional

title.narrative: Citizenship as Agency: Building an analytical framework to explore the dynamic between economic, political, and environemental citizenship.

description.narrative: Governors of St. Francis Xavier University: Coady International Institute in Canada, will coordinate a collaborative research project to explore key issues in citizen-led development. The IAF will collaborate directly in the design of the evolving partnership, and will participate directly in the identification and selection of Latin American participants. The project will directly engage 50 people from Asia, Africa, and the Americas in action research, and indirectly benefit thousands of practitioners and researchers.

participating-org.narrative: Coady International Institute (St. Francis Xavier University)

receiver-org.narrative: Coady International Institute (St. Francis Xavier University)
